CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1941, pg. 18, reads: "Frank Allen Opens New Service Station - Frank E. Allen, well known hauling contractor, has just opened his new streamlined Gulf Service Station at Center [Centre] avenue and Kirkpatrick street, near the new Terrace Village. The station is modern in every respect.  Every detail in construction of this station has been designed with the aim of greater service and convenience for car owners.  The building has a glistening porcelain enamel front and contains facilities for Gulflex lubrication and car washing.  The equipment is the finest available and all work is done by experts according to Gulf specifications. Special attention has been given to restroom facilities.  Motorists are given the assurance that they will find these tile restrooms immaculately clean at all times.  Gulfpride Motor Oil, Gulf No-Nox Ethy and the complete line of Gulf petroleum products and Goodrich tires and accessories will be marketed.  Mr. Allen has chosen Gulf because he believes that Gulf products are always of the finest quality.  Frank Allen invites his many friends and acquaintances to stop in to examine his attractive service center.  He will endeavor to satisfy each of his customer's personal motoring needs.  Right is George A. Douglas, manager; left, William Williams, Samuel Morris, Harrison Dennis, attendants."
TitMainTitle: Frank E. Allen's Gulf Station with two dark cars at pumps, at Centre Avenue and Humber Alley, Hill District, another version
